parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: See! Lo! Behold! Look! Second person singular imperative middle voice of eido; used as imperative lo!

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Singular

str2: Quickly, speedily. Neuter singular of tachus; shortly, i.e. Without delay, soon, or suddenly, or readily.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
(a) pay, wages, salary, (b) reward, recompense, punishment. Apparently a primary word; pay for service, good or bad.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
From apo and didomi; to give away, i.e. Up, over, back, etc.
Each (of more than two), every one. As if a superlative of hekas; each or every.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.
